instruction: The school offers an externship but does not have any formal written agreement with the facility.
response: Non-compliant. A written agreement between the institution and each externship service facility is required. (Requirement 1)

instruction: Students are placed in a licensed salon for externship in a state that mandates licensure.
response: Compliant. If state licensing is required, the facility must be licensed by the state. (Requirement 2)

instruction: The externship facility is unlicensed but holds a valid business license. The state does not require a special license for this type of service.
response: Compliant. If no state license is required, the facility must have a business license to operate. (Requirement 3)

instruction: Supervisors in the externship hold state-required licenses in the relevant field.
response: Compliant. Supervisors must hold any required certification or license. (Requirement 4a)

instruction: The externship supervisor does not have a license (not required by the state) but has 6 months of experience.
response: Non-compliant. Supervisors must have at least one year of experience if no license is required. (Requirement 4b)

instruction: The externship component accounts for 5% of the program's total hours.
response: Compliant. Students may not accrue more than 10% of the program in externship, unless a health/wellness program with an approved exception. (Requirement 5)

instruction: The school places students in an externship located in another state but does not check for state authorization.
response: Non-compliant. If the externship occurs out of state, state authorization must be obtained, if applicable. (Requirement 5)

instruction: Students are randomly selected for externship opportunities without written eligibility criteria.
response: Non-compliant. The institution must select students based on written criteria. (Requirement 6)

instruction: The school evaluates each student's academic performance before approving them for externship.
response: Compliant. Students must meet written selection criteria to participate. (Requirement 6)

instruction: The school allows students into externship without requiring them to pass a written or practical exam.
response: Non-compliant. Students must pass a comprehensive written and practical exam to qualify. (Requirement 7)

instruction: Students complete a written and practical exam demonstrating readiness before externship.
response: Compliant. This satisfies the requirement to establish student qualification. (Requirement 7)

instruction: The externship program has no formal written training plan or goals.
response: Non-compliant. A written training plan and goals must outline expected applications and experiences. (Requirement 8)

instruction: The school prepares a document listing specific objectives for the externship, tailored to each program.
response: Compliant. Training plans must specify particular applications and experiences to be gained. (Requirement 8)

instruction: A school official visits externship sites quarterly to ensure compliance and observe student activity.
response: Compliant. Periodic site visits by an institution official are required. (Requirement 9)

instruction: The school does not follow up with externship sites once students are placed.
response: Non-compliant. The institution must make periodic visits to verify requirements are being met. (Requirement 9)

instruction: Students complete externships, but the service facility does not provide any evaluation of their performance.
response: Non-compliant. The establishment must evaluate the student's performance during the externship. (Requirement 10)

instruction: Service facilities submit evaluation forms showing student achievement of training objectives.
response: Compliant. Students must be evaluated with respect to their attainment of objectives. (Requirement 11)

instruction: Facilities do not certify student attendance or hours earned during the externship.
response: Non-compliant. A certificate of attendance and training must be completed by the establishment. (Requirement 12)

instruction: Externship hours certified by the facility are not counted by the school toward course completion.
response: Non-compliant. Institutions must recognize certified externship training (hours/competencies/credits) toward course completion. (Requirement 13)

instruction: The school counts hours certified by the externship facility toward graduation requirements.
response: Compliant. Schools must recognize verified externship training toward the student's program completion. (Requirement 13)
